intro: Exacum trinervium subsp. macranthum, commonly known as the large-flowered African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically produces violet or purple flowers with five petals, which bloom in spring and summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. This subspecies is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
